STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 25, 2025
Jennifer Savage
BENZIE/MANISTEE DHHS
1672 US-31 SOUTH S,
MANISTEE, MI, 49660-8942
RE: License#: CP510201273
Dear Ms. Savage:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 06/19/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City MI 49684
231-383-5531
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the
development of service plans to enable the
parent or parents and foster parents to
understand the plan for the child and the
parents' and the foster parent's role in assisting
the agency in carrying out the plan. An agency
shall give a copy to and review the parent-
agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
and any other information about the child and
the child's family is confidential.
One out of three files reviewed contained a PATP that documented late foster
parent signatures.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following area:
• Technical assistance was provided regarding R 400.12417, Foster Parent
Information. In one file the DHS-3307 was not completed however a social
work contact dated 6-11-2024 documented that the foster care worker
reviewed and provided the information required by the rule to the foster
parent on the day of placement. There was some vagueness in the contact
regarding the worker thoroughly covering sub-rule (d) and (g).
Recommended that the agency utilize the DHS-3307 consistently for all
cases.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with the CAP is as follows: The agency
submitted an approved corrective action plan on 7-3-2024 in response to a policy
violation established during the 6-7-2024 Interim Inspection. There was not a
repeat violation as the department is no longer auditing DHHS policy.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Assessment was thorough and well written. The
Program Manger conducts an internal quality review, and the review is thorough
and documented. Barriers were discussed and noted that multiple high needs
youth in residential can demand much time that can pull focus away from other
cases. The anticipated merger of Benzie/Manistee counties with Mason County
has resulted in workers concerns about future work status as well as additional
workloads. The assessment also noted that additional travel time has occurred as
workers will have to travel into Mason County.
The assessment further addressed the rule violation from the 2024 Interim
Inspection and the agencies efforts to prevent future violations.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local DHHS office and therefore financial records were not
available.

Staff Interviews
Staff interviewed reported enjoying working for the agency. Staff reported that they
feel supported by their supervisor and there is a strong supportive foster care
team at the agency.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has two offices, one in Manistee and one in Beulah. The Manistee
office was my first visit there and is a new location for the agency from the
previous office which was also located in Manistee. The agency has sufficient
office space. CHRI documents are stored at the Beulah office location and were
observed to be secured appropriately.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst did not find any safety concerns during her visits to the homes.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
June 20, 2025
_____________________________________
Douglas Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant

June 25, 2025
